revised_title: Microelectrochemical Devices for Sensor Applications: Modification of Microelectrode Arrays
tldr: This article describes the development of microelectrochemical devices using modified microelectrode arrays for sensor applications. These devices can be used to detect changes in chemical and biological substances by connecting two or more closely spaced microelectrodes with redox-active materials. The author discusses various examples of these devices, including those based on poly(3-methylthiophene), poly(-vinylpyridine), and a quinone redox polymer, and explains their potential applications in sensing.
